isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 9800 - CAB: 5000, 9100, 9200, 9300, 9400 - REMOVE AND INSTALL - AIR WIPER MOTOR (HEADER MOUNTED, PASSENGER SIDE)

svcproc.title: AIR WIPER MOTOR (HEADER MOUNTED, PASSENGER SIDE)

step1.para: Remove acorn nut, lockwasher and wiper arm and blade ( Items 5, 4, and 3, Figure 90). Refer to WIPER ARM, Remove.
Remove the serrated drive bushing, weather seal, hex lock nut, outer spacer, leather flat washer and inner spacer ( Items 6 thru 11, Figure 90) from the wiper motor shaft ( Item 12, Figure 90).

Remove the 6 mounting screws ( Item 2, Figure 94) from the cab header and remove the passenger side (right) wiper motor cover panel ( Item 1, Figure 94). Position the cover panel out of the way to remove the passenger wiper motor assembly ( Item 2, Figure 93).

Disconnect and remove the air supply lines ( Item 5, Figure 93) and exhaust valve air line ( Item 8, Figure 93) from the passenger side wiper motor assembly ( Item 2, Figure 93). Note the routing of the air lines for installation.
Remove 2 motor mounting bracket bolts ( Item 3, Figure 94) below the passenger side wiper motor cover panel opening, then remove wiper motor assembly ( Item 2, Figure 93) from the vehicle.

calloutgroup.callout1: 1. WIPER MOTOR COVER PANEL PASSENGER SIDE (RIGHT)
2. PANEL MOUNTING SCREWS (6 PLACES) 10 IN-LBS. (1.2 NM)
3. MOTOR BRACKET MOUNTING BOLTS (2 PLACES) 240 TO 265 IN-LBS. (27 TO 30 NM)

note.para: Make sure the air motor is in the park position before installation.

step1.para: If removed, fasten the motor mounting bracket to the wiper motor with the bolts, lockwashers and nuts. Tighten to 40 to 62 in-lbs. (4.5 to 7 Nm).
Position the passenger side wiper motor assembly in the header through the wiper motor cover panel opening.
Route air supply lines and exhaust valve air line and attach them to the passenger side wiper motor assembly.

note.para: Make certain that the exhaust valve air line ( Item 8, Figure 93) extends through the bulkhead grommet ( Item 13, Figure 93) into the engine compartment at least 3 inches (75 mm).

step1.para: Fasten the passenger side motor mounting bracket to the cab header with bolts. Tighten to 240 to 265 in-lbs. (27 to 30 Nm).
Position the wiper motor cover panel on the header and secure it with the 6 mounting screws. Tighten to 10 in-lbs. (1.2 Nm).
Install the inner spacer, leather flat washer, outer spacer, hex lock nut, weather seal and serrated drive bushing on the wiper motor shaft.
Install the wiper arm and blade, lockwasher and acorn nut on the wiper motor shaft. Refer to WIPER ARM, Install.
